Bag O' Links - 3/11/2010

Links

  • Super cool CSS3 recipes – from Woork.
  • Best practices for HTML emails – Tables, Inline CSS an other weapons of the apocalypse.
  • 5 Rails plugins to optimize your MySQL – RailsIndexes is there, wohoo.
  • Super Cheatsheet collection for designers and developers – CSS, HTML, JS…it’s all there.
  • High Availability MySQL stack – this tutorial focuses on EC2, but can be easily implied on other hosting solutions.
  • CoffeeScript intro – i should be reading this one very soon.
  • Getting Started with Rails checklist – looks nice but it’s based on the fact the person who is learning, already has experience with web technologies.
  • List of Cross Browser CSS properties – DIE IE.
  • Face detection with JS and Canvas – wow.
  • Left outer join with AREL – Ryan’s new Ruby only blog is kick-starting.
  • /app/observers: where they should be – Adam fights the observer blasphemy.
  • Avoiding memory leaks in Ruby / Rails – useful.

Treasures

  • Shapado – Rails + MongoDB based stackoverflow clone.
  • SproutsProject – Sprouts is an open-source, cross-platform project generation and configuration tool for ActionScript 2, ActionScript 3, Adobe AIR and Flex projects.
  • Whereuat – Adds a slide out panel to your rails app that directs clients to test stories that have been marked as ‘delivered’ in Pivotal Tracker. brilliant.
  • RubyRegex – Ruby regular expressions library.
  • OpenStack – open source cloud control and management tools.
  • Jo – Awesome JS UI framework.
  • SocialStream – a Devise dependent social features plugin for rails.
  • ruote – a workflow engine, not a state machine.
